reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this place. The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive, from the people at the front desk to the waiter at the delicious buffet breakfast. The hotel is full of nice touches, including super comfy bath robes and beautifully wrapped italian cookies on our pillowcases at night.
reviews.title: This place is amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Chamonix to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. We had casually mentioned this to the hotel when booking, in the context of getting a restaurant recommendation. The hotel staff remembered this and had a big bottle of champagne and beautiful fruit plate waiting for us when we returned from a full day of hiking.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would especially recommend Chamonix in the early season. The prices are super reasonable and the vibe is a lot more relaxed. We went on a gorgeous hike up the Bossons Glacier (of which we had view from our hotel room) and saw only maybe 8 or 10 people on the trail. Chamonix is a great combination of outdoors and luxury. Hotel des Grand Alpes is really special. We are looking forward to returning at some point soon!
reviews.title: Grand Hotel des Alpes

reviews.text: This is an excellent Hotel. We came for a week of Ski and enjoyed it very much.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, we enjoyed it very much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not a big hotel, about 30 rooms. Located in the center of the main restaurant and shops, pedestrian-only street of the town.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are totally new, a lot of wood, mountain fashion, lovely. New baths, extremely clean, we stayed at a Mont Blanc room, nice size. The room was made twice a day,
reviews.title: A real surprise

reviews.text: All of the staff were extremely nice and helpful, they arranged for our ski pass, ski guides, and gave us a 10% discount to rent ski equipment across the street.
reviews.title: Beware of Front Rooms

reviews.text: Very nice and tasty breakfast (pricy though, 20 Euros per person ).
reviews.title: Friendly Chamonix

reviews.text: Stayed here during winter 2009, our first trip to Chamonix.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, centrally located, great service

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, well-located and is staffed by a management that aims to please.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While pricey, you get what you pay for. Free snacks, excellent concierge and free use of pool, hot tub, sauna as well as ski equipment storage. The hotel is on main street, in the center of town. Very cozy. Only disappointment was no fireplace in the room.
reviews.title: Fantasitc Staff

reviews.text: Two notes - parking is 20e/night and breakfast is 20e/person/day.
reviews.title: if you have to stay in Chamomnix, you have to stay here!

reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights with our 11 and 13 y/o in August 2009 and couldn't have been happier. The rooms were compact but smart. The location couldn't be beaten--right in the center of the action in town. Hands down, however were the staff. They were probably the most helpful staff I've encountered anywhere I've stayed. The manager Katjia (sp?), Jerome, and Gudjia were phenomenal, recommending hikes for our family, guiding us to dinner, and even ensuring our daughter had a birthday celebration in an local restaurant. The were always friendly and smiling and seemed tl be thrilled with their work. I would love to return to Chamonix and when doing so would definitely try to stay here again. One tip: The Brevant rooms can get a bit loud on nights with celebrations as the late-night revelers return home into the wee hours of the morning. If you're an average sleeper, you may consider the MontBlanc side if you think you may need to keep your window open. Other than that, absolutely no complaints but many many compliments to a staff that really helped make our trip!
reviews.title: Quite simply the best hotel I have stayed in, very friendly and ideal location
